title: Vectorized Batch of Neurons
story: Real neural networks process multiple inputs at once - this is called batch processing! Instead of computing one input at a time, we use matrix multiplication to process entire batches efficiently. The @ operator performs matrix multiplication in NumPy.
instructions: Import numpy as np. Create batch input `X` = [[1., 0.], [0., 1.], [1., 1.]] (3 samples, 2 features each). Create `w` = [0.5, -0.5] and `b` = 0.1. Compute `outputs` = X @ w + b. Print outputs.
solutionHidden:
import numpy as np
X = np.array([[1., 0.], [0., 1.], [1., 1.]])
w = np.array([0.5, -0.5])
b = 0.1
outputs = X @ w + b
print(outputs)

hints.text: Use @ operator for matrix multiplication: X @ w computes all dot products at once
Broadcasting adds bias to all outputs: (X @ w) gives [val1, val2, val3], then + 0.1
